subject: Technology
title: The Attention Economy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Attention Economy.

hook.text: You are not the customer of most free apps. You are the product being sold to advertisers.

buildup.text: In the attention economy, companies compete for your eyeballs. More screen time means more ad revenue.

discovery.text: Your data, habits, and preferences are packaged into profiles and auctioned to the highest bidder.

twist.text: The more outraged or emotional content makes you, the longer you stay. Algorithms learn to provoke you.

climax.text: This model funds the free internet. But the cost is measured in distraction, anxiety, and polarization.

punchline.text: If the app is free, your attention is the price.

quiz.question: In the attention economy, what is being sold?
options: Your attention and data to advertisers
